comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content:
During the 1920's "hygiene" was big business for the soap manufacturers and most of them ran their own hygiene awareness and hand-washing campaigns supported by lavish merchandising and advertising. Perhaps one of the better known campaigns was Lifebouy's (Lever Brothers) "pro valetudine".

Displays of soap, soap and nothing but soap were not uncommon during this period. I am sure the shopkeeper got a generous kick-back from the soap representatives!

comment.author: 23296461@N04
comment._content: This shop was trading up to the late 1980s/early 1990s. What a wonderful image!
